sourcesContent:
// Mock data for the coding contest platform

export const mockUsers = [
  {
    id: '1',
    email: 'student@test.com',
    password: 'password123',
    name: 'John Doe',
    role: 'contestant',
    round1Completed: false,
    round2Eligible: false,
    round1Score: 0,
    round2Score: 0
  },
  {
    id: '2',
    email: 'admin@test.com',
    password: 'admin123',
    name: 'Admin User',
    role: 'admin'
  }
];

export const mockProblems = {
  round1: [
    {
      id: 'r1p1',
      title: 'Two Sum',
      difficulty: 'Easy',
      description: `Given an array of integers nums and an integer target, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to target.

You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution, and you may not use the same element twice.

You can return the answer in any order.

**Example 1:**
Input: nums = [2,7,11,15], target = 9
Output: [0,1]
Explanation: Because nums[0] + nums[1] == 9, we return [0, 1].

**Example 2:**
Input: nums = [3,2,4], target = 6
Output: [1,2]

**Constraints:**
- 2 <= nums.length <= 10^4
- -10^9 <= nums[i] <= 10^9
- -10^9 <= target <= 10^9`,
      testcases: [
        { input: '[2,7,11,15]\n9', output: '[0,1]', hidden: false },
        { input: '[3,2,4]\n6', output: '[1,2]', hidden: false },
        { input: '[3,3]\n6', output: '[0,1]', hidden: true }
      ]
    },
    {
      id: 'r1p2',
      title: 'Reverse String',
      difficulty: 'Easy',
      description: `Write a function that reverses a string. The input string is given as an array of characters s.

You must do this by modifying the input array in-place with O(1) extra memory.

**Example 1:**
Input: s = ["h","e","l","l","o"]
Output: ["o","l","l","e","h"]

**Example 2:**
Input: s = ["H","a","n","n","a","h"]
Output: ["h","a","n","n","a","H"]

**Constraints:**
- 1 <= s.length <= 10^5
- s[i] is a printable ascii character.`,
      testcases: [
        { input: '["h","e","l","l","o"]', output: '["o","l","l","e","h"]', hidden: false },
        { input: '["H","a","n","n","a","h"]', output: '["h","a","n","n","a","H"]', hidden: false }
      ]
    }
  ],
  round2: [
    {
      id: 'r2p1',
      title: 'Longest Palindromic Substring',
      difficulty: 'Medium',
      description: `Given a string s, return the longest palindromic substring in s.

**Example 1:**
Input: s = "babad"
Output: "bab"
Explanation: "aba" is also a valid answer.

**Example 2:**
Input: s = "cbbd"
Output: "bb"

**Constraints:**
- 1 <= s.length <= 1000
- s consist of only digits and English letters.`,
      testcases: [
        { input: 'babad', output: 'bab', hidden: false },
        { input: 'cbbd', output: 'bb', hidden: false },
        { input: 'racecar', output: 'racecar', hidden: true }
      ]
    }
  ]
};

export const mockRoundInfo = {
  round1: {
    id: 'round1',
    name: 'Round 1',
    status: 'active', // upcoming, active, completed
    startTime: new Date(Date.now() + 1000).toISOString(), // started 1 second ago
    duration: 3600, // 60 minutes in seconds
    problems: mockProblems.round1,
    isLocked: false
  },
  round2: {
    id: 'round2',
    name: 'Round 2',
    status: 'upcoming',
    startTime: null,
    duration: 5400, // 90 minutes in seconds
    problems: mockProblems.round2,
    isLocked: true
  }
};

export const mockParticipants = [
  {
    id: '1',
    name: 'John Doe',
    email: 'student@test.com',
    round1Attendance: true,
    round2Attendance: false,
    round1TestcasesPassed: 4,
    round1TotalTestcases: 5,
    round2TestcasesPassed: 0,
    round2TotalTestcases: 0,
    round1Timestamp: new Date().toISOString(),
    round2Timestamp: null,
    round2Eligible: false,
    submissions: [
      {
        id: 's1',
        problemId: 'r1p1',
        round: 'round1',
        code: 'def twoSum(nums, target):\n    for i in range(len(nums)):\n        for j in range(i+1, len(nums)):\n            if nums[i] + nums[j] == target:\n                return [i, j]',
        language: 'python',
        timestamp: new Date().toISOString(),
        testcasesPassed: 2,
        totalTestcases: 3
      }
    ]
  },
  {
    id: '3',
    name: 'Jane Smith',
    email: 'jane@test.com',
    round1Attendance: true,
    round2Attendance: false,
    round1TestcasesPassed: 5,
    round1TotalTestcases: 5,
    round2TestcasesPassed: 0,
    round2TotalTestcases: 0,
    round1Timestamp: new Date().toISOString(),
    round2Timestamp: null,
    round2Eligible: true,
    submissions: []
  },
  {
    id: '4',
    name: 'Bob Johnson',
    email: 'bob@test.com',
    round1Attendance: true,
    round2Attendance: false,
    round1TestcasesPassed: 3,
    round1TotalTestcases: 5,
    round2TestcasesPassed: 0,
    round2TotalTestcases: 0,
    round1Timestamp: new Date().toISOString(),
    round2Timestamp: null,
    round2Eligible: false,
    submissions: []
  }
];

export const languageOptions = [
  { value: 'python', label: 'Python 3', template: '# Write your code here\n\ndef solution():\n    pass\n\nif __name__ == "__main__":\n    solution()' },
  { value: 'javascript', label: 'JavaScript', template: '// Write your code here\n\nfunction solution() {\n    \n}\n\nsolution();' },
  { value: 'cpp', label: 'C++', template: '#include <iostream>\n#include <vector>\nusing namespace std;\n\nint main() {\n    // Write your code here\n    return 0;\n}' },
  { value: 'java', label: 'Java', template: 'import java.util.*;\n\npublic class Solution {\n    public static void main(String[] args) {\n        // Write your code here\n    }\n}' }
];
